dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4124 IH: Flag Standardization Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller-Meeks introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 4, United States Code, to limit the flags that may be displayed on Federal buildings or grounds, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Flag Standardization Act of 2023.

section.header: Flags displayed on Federal buildings or grounds

subsection.text: Chapter 1 of title 4, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Flags displayed on Federal buildings or grounds.

subsection.text: Only specified flags may be displayed on Federal buildings or grounds.

paragraph.text: The term specified flag means any of the following:

subparagraph.text: The flag of the United States.
The flag of an Indian Tribal government.
A flag of the Armed Forces of the United States.
The National League of Families POW/MIA flag.

paragraph.text: The term State means each State, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.

The term Indian Tribal government means the governing body of any Indian or Alaska Native tribe, band, nation, pueblo, village, or community that the Secretary of the Interior acknowledges to exist as an Indian tribe under the Federally Recognized Indian Tribe List Act of 1994 (25 U.S.C. 479a et seq.).

subsection.text: Subsection (a) shall not apply to military housing.
The analysis for chapter 1 of title 4, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 11. Flags displayed on Federal buildings or grounds.
